## Core Panes

```{=html}
<a href="assets/navigation.png" target="_blank">
  <img src="assets/navigation.png" alt="Navigation Pane" style="width:100%; border-radius:8px; margin-bottom:1rem;">
</a>
```

SEAMAN’s Navigation Pane and climate data summary (Modena, Italy; 2006). Provides geolocated access to climate summaries based on NASA-POWER data. Elements: (a) World map; (b) Köppen–Geiger class + averages; (c) timeline; (d) bar plots for Tmax, Tmin, precipitation with anomalies; (e) automatically generated poetic description.

```{=html}
<a href="assets/representation.png" target="_blank">
  <img src="assets/representation.png" alt="Representation Pane" style="width:100%; border-radius:8px; margin-bottom:1rem;">
</a>
```

SEAMAN’s Representation Pane (1994 shown). (a) Sea waves = monthly temperature anomalies (color + speed); (b) Moon size & color = annual precipitation; (c) 12 stars encode monthly aridity; (d) Sky brightness + sound intensity = annual temperature anomaly.

## Interactive Onboarding Tutorial {#onboarding}

Mapping climate data to visual and auditory elements.

<div class="stack-cards">

```{=html}
<a class="c-card" href="assets/tutorial_sea.png" target="_blank">

  <div class="c-body">
    <h3>SEA</h3>
    <p>24 waves represent monthly temperature anomalies (12 Tmax + 12 Tmin). Colors shift from white–blue (cold) to orange (warm). Motion speed reflects anomaly strength. Hover a wave to see percentiles.</p>
  </div>
</a>
```

```{=html}
<a class="c-card" href="assets/tutorial_moon.png" target="_blank">

    <h3>MOON</h3>
    <p>Annual precipitation is shown as moon size, color, and vertical position. Large green = wet; small pink = dry. Twelve glowing rings encode monthly contributions. Hover rings for precipitation percentiles.</p>
  </div>
</a>
```

```{=html}
<a class="c-card" href="assets/tutorial_stars.png" target="_blank">

    <h3>STARS</h3>
    <p>Stars (Jan→Dec) show monthly aridity. High & sharp = hot/dry; low & soft = wet/cold. Halo size = precipitation percentile. Play them with keys <strong>1–0, O, P</strong>. Hover to reveal climate values.</p>
  </div>
</a>
```
